assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The authors state that LRRK2 mutations are a common cause for Parkinson disease, and this mutation is responsible for 40% of familial PD cases in North Africa and up to 30% in the Ashkenazi Jewish population.  The study also points to a significant fraction of sporadic PD cases.
